posts.author: Estelindis
posts.content: Hi all. I was just wondering: are there some types of feat, spell, or class ability that are great ideas for players but just don't work for henchfolk? I'm trying to put together some builds for henchfolk in my module and thought I should ask the experts. Can provide more info if needed. Thanks.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Heh, i am sure Max will be glad to answer you for that, because if you search the forums here a bit you will see that he has made a whole series of ready to use (optimized) henchman based on some legacy Bioware games of old like Baldur's Gate and even remakes of the core NWN henchmen. He even tried to remain faithful to their original concept, for example Daelan Red Tiger has his trusty double-axe and terrifying rage, Sharwin has her double-sword and bardic abilities so on.

Now, i am not sure if you asked for abilities that does not work for henchmen but are great for players or the opposite but in general, what we see in all of the games is that henchmen are the ones that can afford to be somewhat un-optimized cause their role is to be support for the player characters and not steal the show from them. Of course this tends to be overdone in some cases like in the original henchmen in NWN OC. Many of them where so badly done that they were a hindrance to the player characters instead of helpful (particularly the mage types).

What i think is best, is to have henchmen that have first of all character but also to be able to hold their own in tough situations without stealing the thunder from the hero. that way the hero is thankful that has someone by his side and feels well about that, but at the same time he is always one notch better - he is the protagonist after all, no?

Here is what i feel a great example of how a henchman should be made, although this particular one might be on the strong side (heh you are in the ECB after all). Notice how Max takes a couple of Barbarian levels to stay true to the berserk state of mind of the original character and masterfully takes the best out of them by maxing his taunt skill to provide that extra situational AB.

Minsk - swords not words! --> henchmen-remakes-minsc-from-bg-t2269107.html


Another type of henchmen builds you can make for your module are the pure classes ones. Just try to avoid taking the pre-made packages from Bioware because they are beyond salvation, the rogue package for example does not even have weapon finesse. There are many great pure class builds here as well in case you need one. Here is a a great trio of pure rogues for example by HipMaestro, every single fighter - based hero would like one of them as his henchman.

A Family of Thieves --> yardstick-a-family-of-thieves-3-pure-rogue-40-variants-t2298703.html

posts.author: Estelindis
posts.content: Thanks a million for the thoughtful, helpful comments. Those links already have plenty of great info to use as a starting point.

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Hey dude!

Val, thanks for pointing him in the right direction. I fondly remember those days when you and I exchanged PMs about the BG builds. We haven't done BG I yet, probably my fault cuz I never played that game much. Anyway, those were good times .

I guess since I'm the only one who is crazy enough to undertake this endeavor, I should be the one to provide the links to the builds. OK, here we go! Buckle up, Estelindis, you're in for a LONG journey

Aribeth de Tylmarande

Boddyknock Ginckle

Deekin Scalesinger

Linu La'neral

Xanos Messarmos

Tomi Undergallows

Grimgnaw

Dorna Trapspringer

Sharwyn

Nathyrra

Valen Shadowbreath

Daelan Red Tiger

I must say that my intent when making these was to powerbuild AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE for the henchmen without affecting the character concept. So, basically, what this means is that they aren't in their own sense monster builds, because I couldn't go crazy, but some of them came out SO COOL and powerful that I was extremely proud of myself for the results. When I say this, I mean Nathyrra (whom I've played from 1-36 on WoG and she exceeded every single expectation of mine, being able to solo VERY TOUGH QUESTS, where I could swear she didn't stand a chance), Valen Shadowbreath, Linu La'neral, Sharwyn, Dorna Trapspringer and Daelan Red Tiger.

I hope you have some ideas there. If you want more, let me know. I still have LOADS of BG builds that I've never posted and could give you some extra ideas. Enjoy!

Take it EZ!

posts.author: Estelindis
posts.content:
This is awesome, Max! For me, it's very important to preserve the flavour of the characters, while keeping them useful for combat. These builds do exactly that. I will have a go at adapting them to my henchfolk. Somewhat different personalities necessitate a bit of tweaking. However, a few of them are already almost exactly what I want, e.g. Sharwyn and Daelan. Wish I had a use for Nathyrra! Perhaps I shall have to invent a new henchie just to use that lovely build. Although, actually, if there was a clerical version of her, that would be perfect. I'll try to work one out!

In terms of the others, just in case you happen to already have some unpublished ones that would suit me, I am looking for the following:

1) Forest guide, very focused on personal freedom. Helps people to survive travel through some very dangerous woods; loves the forest's natural beauty, in spite of its deadliness. Was forced to be in a thieves' guild as a child, and hated it. A few levels of rogue, then druid and/or ranger. Not particularly mad about wild shape. More focused on sneaking, traps, and combat, with a bit of nature magic thrown in for good measure.

2) Charitable atoner, trying to help those wronged by his family. Compassionate and brave, but not always good at self-preservation. Paladin, but willing to consider any multiclassing; cleric seems particularly appropriate. Did look at Aribeth but not really that kind of paladin. As much about healing and protection as smiting.

Thanks for helping a girl out!

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Glad we have been of help so far.


Hmm i remember Max had one build for Eclavdra that he hasn't post yet but is basically an Elven Cleric/Assassin (very fragile but very powerful also), so basically he just has to post that build here, it might be what you are looking for.

Girls with a dark past and mystical powers are always cool.

Now for the first one, Minsk can fit there easily as he is a Ranger/Rogue anyway but another option would be an old build Max did for the Baldur's Gate II Druid - Cernd. He is a Druid/ Shifter/ Monk but if you replace the Monk levels with Rogue ones it might be more to your liking (helps also toning down it's power a bit eh eh). Scroll down the page a bit to find it.

Cernd --> http://worldofgreyhawk.fr.yuku.com/topi ... -a-shifter


And as for the second one i would point you again in the unposted build of Max's he made for Keldorn, but you may consider also Cinnabar's good old champion protector.

Champion Protector --> http://home.comcast.net/~worldofgreyhaw ... 14700.html

And finally, my Bane Crusher build seems to fit the idea of the woodsman. However, you'd have to tweak it aslightly to include 4 Rogue levels pre-epic (take them at 1, 8, 13 and 18 for skill dumps):

posts.author: Estelindis
posts.content:
Thanks a bajillion times. These all look great. I will reflect carefully on which one to pick, or whether to cannibalise some features of one or another and mash 'em together.

Sorry for the delay in replying. I have been doing a lot of housework over the past few days! But it is delightful to come back to these brilliant suggestions. Thanks from the bottom of my heart.
